thread.title: Battlestar Galactica star Richard Hatch dead at 71
thread.title_full: Battlestar Galactica star Richard Hatch dead at 71

title: Battlestar Galactica star Richard Hatch dead at 71
text:
Battlestar Galactica star Richard Hatch dead at 71 Last updated 13:15, February 8 2017 TWITTER 
Richard Hatch played Captain Apollo in Battlestar Galactica. 
Richard Hatch, who played Captain Apollo on the original Battlestar Galactica TV series has died. 
TMZ reported that Hatch had cancer and recently went into a hospice care. 
Hatch landing a starring role on Battlestar Galactica in 1978. 
READ MORE: * Battlestar Galactica actors celebrate 10 fraking years 
He also worked as a writer and producer, writing novels based on the popular series. "Richard Hatch was a good man, a gracious man, and a consummate professional," former colleague Ronald D. Moore tweeted after Hatch's death. Very sad to hear about Richard Hatch ðŸ˜¢ #RIP #Apollo pic.twitter.com/Xxgxi3hXmV â€” DARTH VADER (@isDARTHVADER) February 7, 2017 
"His passing is a heavy blow to the entire BSG family." Richard Hatch was a good man, a gracious man, and a consummate professional. His passing is a heavy blow to the entire BSG family. â€” Ronald D. Moore (@RonDMoore) February 7, 2017 
Hatch was 71 years old.
